Package edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.service

Class LocalFilesystemStorageService

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.service.LocalFilesystemStorageService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StorageService
    @Service
public class LocalFilesystemStorageService
extends java.lang.Object
implements StorageService
    Simple implementation of StorageService, storing files in a directory specified in the application properties, further organized into subdirectories by specified portions of the generated filenames.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      LocalFilesystemStorageService​(java.util.Random rng, UploadConfiguration uploadConfiguration, org.springframework.boot.system.ApplicationHome applicationHome)
      Initializes this instance with a source of randomness, a service configuration object (presumably read from application.properties or application.yml), and an instance of ApplicationHome.

      Deletes the file referred to by the provided opaque reference.
      org.springframework.core.io.Resource retrieve​(java.lang.String reference)
      Retrieves a file from a reference (as returned by StorageService.store(MultipartFile)), returning a Resource usable by the consumer.
      java.lang.String store​(org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file)

    • Method Detail

      • store

        public java.lang.String store​(org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              org.springframework.web.HttpMediaTypeNotAcceptableException
        Description copied from interface: StorageService
        Stores the specified file, returning an opaque reference to the file as a String.
        Specified by:
        store in interface StorageService
        Parameters:
        file - Uploaded file.
        Returns:
        Opaque reference, to be used when retrieving or deleting the file from the store.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be written for any reason.
        org.springframework.web.HttpMediaTypeNotAcceptableException - If the content-type of file is not allowed.

      • retrieve

        public org.springframework.core.io.Resource retrieve​(java.lang.String reference)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: StorageService
        Retrieves a file from a reference (as returned by StorageService.store(MultipartFile)), returning a Resource usable by the consumer. When an exception is thrown by this method, the consumer should generally assume that subsequent invocations for the specified file will fail as well.
        Specified by:
        retrieve in interface StorageService
        Parameters:
        reference - Opaque reference to the file, as returned by StorageService.store(MultipartFile).
        Returns:
        Consumer-usable Resource.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be read for any reason.

      • delete

        public boolean delete​(java.lang.String reference)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
                      java.lang.SecurityException
        Description copied from interface: StorageService
        Deletes the file referred to by the provided opaque reference.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface StorageService
        Parameters:
        reference - Opaque reference String returned from StorageService.store(MultipartFile).
        Returns:
        true if the file was successfully deleted from the store; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be accessed (for any reason) from the specified reference.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the file store is write-only.
        java.lang.SecurityException - If the current process does not have permission to delete the specified file.
